Vulnerability.Title: initial-setup bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The initial-setup utility runs after installation. It guides the user through a series of steps that allows for easier configuration of the machine. The initial-setup packages have been upgraded to upstream version 0.3.9.30, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version, and brings initial-setup in line with the the updated anaconda packages. (BZ#1229747) This update also fixes the following bugs: In localized versions of Red Hat Enterprise Linux, the Initial Setup application in some cases terminated unexpectedly when starting. With this update, the localization is now initialized earlier during the startup of Initial Setup, which prevents the described crash from occurring. (BZ#1198642) On IBM Power Systems, the initial-setup utility terminated unexpectedly when starting due to the hvc0 console not being blocked. This update adds hvc0 to the list of blocked consoles, which allows initial-setup to start correctly on IBM Power Systems. (BZ#1209731) The initial-setup-ks.cfg file is no longer world-readable by default, but rather uses the same default permissions as the anaconda-ks.cfg file. (BZ#1264336) In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: It is now possible to trigger the Initial Setup application in reconfiguration mode when Initial Setup has already been used after the installation. This allows the use of Initial Setup to change the configuration of their operating system (OS) at any time. To trigger the reconfiguration, create the /etc/reconfigSys file, enable the graphical or text-based Initial Setup service (depending on the OS environment), and reboot the system. (BZ#1110439) Users of initial-setup are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
